intro: Emmenanthe salina, commonly known as the salt marsh bellflower, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the southeastern United States. It thrives in brackish or saline wetlands, showcasing its adaptation to high salt concentrations. The plant features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it often grows in dense clusters along the edges of tidal marshes. Emmenanthe salina plays an important ecological role by stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various insects and birds.
